The air rushed through is fur as he shot down towards the jungled planet beneath him. Falco’s voice chirped on the communicator. “Hey buddy, we need to rendezvous about and a mile and a half north of where you jumped. I’m sending the coordinates for the location to your navigation unit. Once there, Pepper and Peppy will brief us on the mission. See ya’ later.”
“Bye Fox!” Slippy chimed in.
“….bye Slippy.” Fox finished awkwardly. He deployed his parachute as his Arwing (now on autopilot above) headed back towards Great Fox. This was just another odd job that the Star Fox team had to pull off to keep the lights on and the ships fueled in between big pay jobs. However money had been becoming tighter so the jobs became odder and odder as time passed. He was relieved to have semi-real mission after a long dry spell. The ground quickly rose to meet fox as he braced himself for landing. The ground was soft and muddy causing the fox to sink a bit on impact. He quickly unhooked his parachute and jumped out of the wet mud. “Dammit, my boots.” Fox moaned shaking his feet attempting unsuccessfully to remove the gunk from his boots. Giving up he radioed Falco. “Can you send me the coordinates?”
“Yep, here they are, meet you in 20. Keep your hand on your blaster. We have no idea what lives on this planet.”
“Ha-ha, shoot first ask questions later?”
“As always. I’m landing soon so I’ll be out of contact for a bit, if anything happens try and get Slip.”
“Will do.” Fox finished. He walked out of the clearing and into the thick of the jungle with his hand resting firmly on his blaster. The air was humid and heavy. Fox was relieved that he had chosen relatively light clothes. He wore a sleeveless shit under his usual vest and a pair of light pants, to keep the wildlife off of his legs. The jungle was relatively quiet, besides the general noise of the ambiance and the squelching of his shoes of the soft earth. However this was interrupted by a growl coming from Fox’s stomach. However he dismissed it and continued walking on.
Money had been relatively tight and the rules always went fuel before food on the ship. Hence it had been a day since he had had a real meal. Needless to say Fox needed little exercise to keep an athletic figure. He had very little fat on his body and due to the lessened food intake needed little exercise to keep in shape. He clocked in at about 5’9’’ 145lbs. He continued through the jungle until he was interrupted again by a growl. He was very hungry, starving in fact. 1121.content:
"Boys, we've got a new mission. Code 3. Debrief in my office in five minutes."

As Peppy's voice broke out over the Great Fox's loudspeaker, Fox and Krystal both swore under their breath. It had only been two days since Fox and Falco got back from a tougher-than-necessary mission to the Fifth Galaxy Division, where a small band of rebels who had taken it upon themselves to deify Andross had decided to raise some hell. While the two fighters made short work if their targets, it had taken three days longer than necessary. The dogfight was easy, but once the rebels realized they were severely outmatched, they took hostages and holed up in the first apartment they could find, paying dozens of residents to fight off any intruders. Of course, McCloud and Lombardi were able to take care of business, but securing the hostages was a tough deal. Fox was still aching and a bit overtired, and had been relaxing with Krystal when the call came out.

"I can't believe Peppy's calling you back out already," Krystal pouted.

"Trust me, I'm not happy about this one, either. But Code 3s are simple escort missions. I can probably set my autopilot and sleep the whole way there. If I'm not back in two days, I'll drop you a line. Otherwise, we'll be fine."

Fox gave Krystal a hug and a quick peck on the mouth before he grabbed his jacket and went to the debrief. Just as he expected, it was an easy mission. A young, rich lynx wanted an escort party from her college on Stardenia back home to Sunomio for spring break. She was a daddy's girl, and daddy had offered Team Fox three months' usual pay for this one mission.

It was all formality from there. Fox, Falco, Slippy and ROB headed out and got to Stardenia in a few hours. Once there, the four met the girl and drew straws to see who'd get to sleep and who had to keep watch at what time as they prepped their autopilots. Fox won some well-deserved sleep, and didn't notice a minor but glaring typo as he typed "Sumomio" into his onboard computer. As the ships lifted into space, he drifted into dreamland, and the rest of the team didn't notice as his ship slowly but surely fell out of rotation and started veering out wide left.

Fox awoke hours later, finally recovered from his previous journey, just as he entered Sumomio's atmosphere. As the ship drifted closer to the ground, Fox realized his team was nowhere to be found. As it taxied around an entry point to the planet, he realized this wasn't Sunomio. But he didn't truly realize the severity of the situation until he climbed out of his ship and right into the waiting arms of two very large lions in rubber jumpsuits.

As the two felines started to carry the vulpine into an imposing-looking immigration room, he determined that something was very, very wrong. Glancing left and right at his captors, he was taken aback. The rubber jumpsuits, one red and one blue, strained to retain what must have been 650 pounds of hefty big cat each. In doing so, he didn't notice a looming round slide dropping at a diagonal angle into the floor. Which made it a real shock when they dropped him right into it.

McCloud yelled as he quickly rode the decline, again when he was hit by a cold clear spray that dissolved his clothing, and a third time when his decline was suddenly halted as he fell directly into an orange and black jumpsuit, much like the ones his captor lions were wearing. Just as quickly as the slide started, though, it suddenly halted, and Fox found himself in a ten-foot by ten-foot room with a massive TV screen in front of him. It jumped awake, and as its image came into view, Fox found himself face-to-face with a massive tabby cat. Easily pushing a full ton, the cat wore a golden jumpsuit much like Fox and the lions did.

"Hello, and welcome to Sumomia!", the cat began. "We're glad that you've decided to visit our wonderful planet. My name is King Anthony the Eighth. 150 years ago, my great-great grandparents, starved and delirious, managed to escape the infamous Ryat War, landing on this planet as its first residents. Planting the last of their seeds and praying for a fertile climate, they were the first of many to discover just how special this planet's atmosphere is. Those first plants came to fruition in only three days, and what's more, the harvests were more bountiful than ever seen before - with the caveat that their nutritional values and the natural air combined to overload the average body's metabolism. After one week, my starving ancestors had gained ten pounds - in a month, they'd gone from evacuated to overweight.

In the time since, Sumomia has become a celebration of everything fat. We're global champions of sumo wrestling and one of the largest exporters of food to struggling planets in the universe. We're proud of our global weight in the market and flaunt it accordingly.

Of course, you're here because our body scanners upon entry found you aren't nearly close to our planetary standard weight. We require all residents to have body weight percentages of at least 40 percent, though the more the merrier. I, personally, hold the record, at 1,942 pounds and a percentage of 97.8. You will not be allowed to leave your current room until you meet this mandate. You have two options, as such: voluntary gain or involuntary." As he said the second, Anthony's face contorted just the slightest bit.

"We hope you make the right decision to respect our heritage. Once again, welcome to Sumomia, and we hope you have the time of your life here!"

As Anthony's face left the screen, two options came up on the screen, which Fox walked up to. The two buttons simply said :) and :(. A timer began counting down from 30 seconds.

11211.content:
Fox considered his options, quickly realizing that he didn't have many to choose from. As the timer ticked away, he knew that no matter what happened, he was going to have to get fat. If it's the nature of the planet, he wasn't getting away without gaining a few pounds, and he didn't want to think about what might happen if he went against the grain. Better to take control of the situation while he still could, mitigating the damage and making sure he wasn't taken prisoner. With time still on the clock, McCloud pressed the :) button.

After a second's pause, a second video of Anthony came up on the screen. He seemed happy. "Splendid! We hope you enjoy your time on our wonderful planet!" As the cat continued talking, the room slowly but surely filled up with a faint but noticeable green gas. "That gas is relatively harmless, a simple cocktail we've prepared on this planet to make your new gain as easy to stomach as possible. In a few moments, our automatic kitchen will begin preparing some high-quality dishes for you, and the gas is intended specifically to speed your digestion and make your weight gain as fast and easy as possible. In a second, the screen will offer a variety of foods for you to choose from, all the highest quality, and you can select whatever you want. We'll let you know when your body fat percentage reaches an acceptable level, though you can continue eating for as long as you want."

The fat cat's face disappeared, replaced by a basic touch screen module filled with dozens of different types of food. Separated by meal and ethnicity, Fox found that almost every type of food he could imagine was at his fingertips. Up in the corner of the screen, a small line said "15%," clearly the fox's current body fat percentage.

Fox searched through the selections and finally decided to start by pressing a button for a chocolate milkshake. Mere seconds later, an unseen door in the wall slid open and out came a tray holding the biggest milkshake Fox had ever seen. The size of a bucket and packed to the brim with ice cream, milk and chocolate sauce, the fox thought he had died and went to heaven and took a sip. It was, indeed, one of the best things he'd ever tasted. One sip became two, became four, became a gulp and then a chug - Fox noticed that since the gas had sprayed him, his appetite had grown as well.

A few minutes later, Fox was highly regretful, as he had just finished the gigantic milkshake. Panting and holding his belly, which was noticeably distended by two inches and accentuated by the jumpsuit, he groaned and took a deep breath. Suddenly, his gut shrank a bit. Breathing in again, Fox saw his stomach process the milkshake instantly, his gut emptying and spreading its contents throughout his body. Checking the screen, Fox's "15%" had become a "16%."

Thinking things couldn't get much worse, Fox resigned himself to a feast he'd likely never have a chance to enjoy again. Ordering a steak, then a triple cheeseburger with chili fries, then a massive ice cream sundae, he dined continually, pausing after each dish to allow his stomach to settle. Over time, he watched himself grow fat. First the gain was barely noticeable - his arms were a bit pudgier than before, or his chest saw a slight bit of padding. After a few hours, though, his gut had extended inches off his body. Another three bowls of pasta later, his thighs were touching, and checking his reflection in the screen, he was working on a big double chin. At this point, he was becoming obese, and his percentage showed - he had crested 30 percent body fat.

113.content:
Fox McCloud, a name that spanned the galaxy with equal parts fame and infamy. He had saved the Lylat more ways than one, taken on challenges that would've made lesser people quake in their boots and flee. Now he was on the hardest assignment of his life.

Father and loving husband.

It had been a good five years since the Star Fox team had disbanded. Fox remembered it like it was only five days. Krystal had announced to him that she was pregnant. Pregnant with his child. The shocking news suddenly catapulted him into a flurry of life changing decisions.

After a long hour of discussion. Fox and Krystal both decided that, for the sake of the child, they would stay together. Fox knew that he was probably more responsible for courting the young vixen to bed, and if he left the child without a real father...

Well such an idea bothered him. Growing up an orphan was, more or less life scarring.

That also tied into the next decision. Getting Fox out of action.

His father died on the job. Something that both Fox and Krystal did not want for the child. So it was settled between them that they should leave the Star Fox team for good. A decision that caused a lot of friction between his friends and fellow teammates, but it was not argued.

Fox had turned his back on the action packed life of a bounty hunter forever.

Of course the allure of piloting and seeing all the various worlds of the Lylat had led to his new career. As a commercial pilot. It was not exactly the safest job but he got it the fastest. The company "Lylat Jets" was extremely shocked that ace pilot Fox McCloud had suddenly appeared, wanting to simply fly their spaceships. He was hired there on the spot.

Life as a pilot had become sedentary to say the least. He would be sitting down for hours at a time, taking passengers to and fro. As a pilot he could only leave the plane for so long on certain days and normally found himself eating the fast food and downing a soda on the spaceship. Fox's metabolism, used to months of toning and training, neutralized the food and soda as it had for years.

But after the first month or so things had begun to change in his body.

Fox's normally flat body had begun to soften. It was subtle at first. Five pounds in the next two months. But things slowly spiraled further down. At the end of the year he needed to go up a size in uniform.

Five years later going through this job without much change in routine led to a rather large change in Fox himself.

His body had gone from toned to tubby and the time when he was toned was just a long lost memory. Instead of chiseled abs he now had small pot belly, usually filled with brand soda and airline food. His angular face had bulged out, giving him a "moon face." His legs and rump had not escaped the damage, filling out rather rapidly with their lack of use. His arms too were showing signs of gain, his fingers chubby and almost sausage like.

And this is the Fox we see now, laying in his bed, staring at the ceiling half awake. His wife lay there...

It reminded him somewhat of his bounty hunting days.

The vast quiet of space, save for the low hum of his arwing. Sometimes he'd fly out by himself as a way to get away from his teammates. He loved them like family, Slippy and Falco, but they really had a bad habit of arguing. Trying to keep one's cool as team leader was rough sometimes.

For the past five years he had not really seen much of Falco or Slippy, he had to actually think back to when he saw them last. It had to be on a chance visit when he was on his way to Fortuna with some adventurous tourists. They bumped into eachother at the shuttle port, Falco and Slippy had kept the team going as best they could. Recruiting two new kids ("man I am getting old") to help fill the spot of Fox.

Lucy Hare was one, she was Peppy's daughter, he remembered way back when he'd babysit her. She had to be almost 20 now. Then there was some other kid he didn't recognize, Dash Bowman. Fox was just starting to lose his figure around that time. It was back in the days of Medium shirts and 30 inch waist pants.

Suddenly Fox's PDA buzzed, he glanced down at it, he was getting a voice message. He checked the caller, "Jamie Salsberg." He rolled his eyes and answered it.

"Hello?"

"Mr. McCloud?" An unsure voice asked on the other line.

"Yeah its me, what's up?"

"We're having a little difficulty at the shuttleport, somebody's here and they say they know you?"

Fox sat still, thinking for a moment. He thought he heard a scream on the other end of the phone somewhere in the background.

"What was that?"

Jamie's voice started getting panicky. "Oh that! 'sjust Melissa, you know how she is with spiders and..."

"Who wants to see me?"

"Says they're an old bounty hunter friend, says they want to catch up on old times."

"Alright that's nice and all, any specifics?"

More panic.

"Want it to be a surprise..."

Fox was stopped his car for a moment, the shuttleport was coming into view. It looked dead silent. Which was beyond weird for a Friday morning.

"Jamie who is it?"

The line went dead.

"Dammit." Fox sighed and put his PDA back in his pocket and drove just a little closer to the airport. There really was no body at the entrance, cars were left vacant where they stood. Something was seriously wrong. With a gulp Fox pulled his car up near the edge of main entrance of the gate. Security was absent from their position.

The shuttleport was in real danger, real life danger, and the only person for miles was a portly out of shape former bounty hunter. His first response was to phone the police, he knew it would take a long time for them to get there, and whomever had taken on the entire Port without anyone alerting the police was some force of nature. Fox typed in a code on his glove compartment, with a small whoosh it opened, revealing his old blaster and some other important documents.

"Never thought I'd have to use this again." He muttered. He only kept it around for nostalgic purposes, and the possibility it might see some action one day. He hoped he wouldn't have to use it, but of course things never quite worked that way for him.

With a gulp he exited his car and kept his blaster holstered at his side. Slowly, and as stealthy as possible, he made his way up to the front of the airport. He knew walking right up to the front door would be a bad idea. There were security cams, and no cover. However there was a possibility. A staff-only area that included a lounge as well as a way to the security checkpoints. Metal detectors and other means to keep unsightly people onto the shuttles were there.

Of course they had always been lax on security, perhaps that proved to be their undoing.

Panting and keeping his head low, Fox quickly made his way to the staff-only door. He pulled out his keycard and slid it into a slot on the door's automated lock. It made a small beep, and the red light on the lock changed to green. He pushed the door open and walked, making sure to shut it quietly behind him.

Fox was sweaty, he hadn't run that far for that long for a long time. His heart was pounding and his belly was rising rapidly up and down. "Jeez I hope I don't die of a heartattack before I get there."

He kept low the whole time, listening for any signs of life at the doors along the hall. It was chillingly quiet. All he could hear was his taxed breathing and pounding heart. He opened one door and had to stifle a yelp. On the ground was a pile of dead security guards.

Who the hell did this? He almost didn't want to find out, but at the same time they wanted him personally.

With a gulp he made his way further down the hall. It took a moment to convince himself to open the door to the security check point, with a deep breath he pushed it open slowly and peeked out. Sitting at one of the metal detectors was Leon Powalski, smoking a cigarette, his blaster resting on the conveyor belt.

Fox needed to keep his element of surprise and there was no way he was getting out there quietly with his girth. Then again he might not have too...

~~

Leon jumped a little when he heard a loud click from across the room, his eyes shifted around and suddenly found an open door. It was the one that led to the staff only area. Where all the bodies of the supposedly dead security guards were. He could smell a trap, but he was conditioned to feel no pain. He half way enjoyed it as a matter of fact.

Whatever the lone security guard could do, without a weapon, was probably minimal. Though he loved to hunt, and he loved when his prey played rough.

With nimble legs he shuffled to the open door and peered inside. He heard a loud grunt and a tearing noise coming from the lounge. Smiling he raised his blaster to shoot and ran into the room. However as soon as he opened the door, a coffee pot was smashed over his head.

What would've knocked a normal person out only dazed Leon, he stumbled around a little pointing his gun wildly. Suddenly he felt a heavy weight push him to the ground and hold him there while he squirmed. A thick arm reached its way around his neck and held itself there. In a moments time Leon succumbed to a sleeper hold and passed out there on the floor.

Fox stood up and dusted his now ruined pants off. He turned his head around to get a good look at his back-side. His rump had burst the seam of his pants finally. With a blush and curse, he continued onwards. It was just a rip. As a matter of fact it made room for his "presence" as Krystal called it.

Just further along the security checkpoint was the flight desk. And who else was there but Wolf O'Donnel and Panther Caroso. With a sigh he held his back to a wall and weighed his options. He could get close enough to Panther and bash him over the head with a blunt object, and Wolf was right next to him.

However he had to be fast enough to disarm Wolf. He knew that Panther would go down easy, he always did.

"Doesn't make any sense...Just three guys did this?" He muttered.

Fox picked up a fire extinguisher and made his way closer to Panther and Wolf. The two were distracted, Panther had his gun pointed at Jamie, who was tied to his chair. Wolf was casually resting against the desk, with his gun holstered. Fox held his breath, he was just a few yards away. With a grunt he stood up and charged as fast as his fat body could go.

Panther didn't know what hit him, the fire extinguisher knocked him out cold. Fox turned towards Wolf, who was reaching for his blaster...

113111.content:
Fox managed to grapple with Wolf for a moment and wrestle the blaster away from his hands, it feel clattering to the floor and off to the side.

"Who the hell are you?" Wolf snapped and jumped out of Fox's grapple.

He didn't recognize him. Fox almost laughed, had he really changed that much? Wolf threw a right hook and Fox instinctively dodged back and returned with a hard jab to the stomach. Wolf clutched his torso as Fox delivered an upper cut to his head.

With a gasp Wolf stumbled backwards. "Alright fatboy enough games." Wolf growled and bared his teeth. He held up his razor sharp claws and smiled. Fox wiped the sweat from his face and held up his fists. It had been so long since he had done anything like this. He couldn't believe in the shape he was in he was holding his own as good as he was.

Wolf swiped at Fox with his claw, grazing his shirt and leaving three fine tears along the midsection of his shirt. Fox yelped as he felt a little blood trickle down his belly. Panting Fox knew that wasn't going to be able to keep up with Wolf's speed. He was going to have to go all out while he still could. With that in mind he stepped back a bit and let Wolf advance, giving Wolf the feeling that he had the upper hand. That Fox was submitting.

Then as Wolf tried to swipe with his claws again Fox used as much energy as he could to dodge and grabbed the fire extinguisher that had knocked out Panther with. He heaved the thing over his head with all his might and smashed it into Wolf's skull, the crushing blow made him bite his tongue, blood trickled onto the floor. Fox bashed Wolf in the gut and knocked him on his back.

"Wh-who are you?" Wolf panted.

"The name's Fox McCloud, and don't you forget it." Fox grunted and threateningly held the fire extinguisher above Wolf's head.

Wolf squinted for a moment and then chuckled, "took you long enough," then he passed out there on the ground.

Fox panted heavily and dropped the fire extinguisher on the ground. Slowly he stumbled back and sat in a chair. Sweat pouring down his forehead as he tore open his captains shirt to assess the damage. It was nothing serious actually, the cuts did not go deep, and it seemed only the tips of the claws hit him. It was like his extra blubber had protected his vitals.

The term "kevlard" popped up in his mind, he groaned at the pun and turned towards Jamie.

"Wow Mr. McCloud, you still got it!" Jamie cheered. "Can you untie me? These ropes are chaffing."

"Yeah...hold on." Fox nodded as he took another second to catch his breath. He wiped the sweat from his brow again and shuffled over to Jamie, he grabbed a knife from Panther's unconscious body and cut the rope.

"Thank you! I promise I won't make fat jokes about you behind your back again."

"So long as they're good I don't care." Fox smiled and punched Jamie playfully on the shoulder.

"You look a little beat though Sir, can I get you anything?"

"Just get me something to drink, I'm parched." Fox said fanning his face with his captains hat. Jamie nodded and ran to a vending machine nearby and turned back to Fox.

"I thought I was a goner and that Kevin didn't make it to the phones in time to call you! I'm surprised he called you of all people but I'm glad he did." Jamie said as he tossed a bottle of soda

"Kevin didn't call me..." Fox tilted his head confused. "and where is everyone else?"

"They're all locked up and tied up in some other room. They kept me out here because they knew I knew you?"

"How'd they know that?" Fox said as he opened the bottle of soda and chugged it.

"We...well...I...well they were asking around and I blurted out that you were captain."

"To malicious characters that just might look like Star Wolf?" Fox folded his arms and raised an eyebrow at Jamie.

"I know, I know I'm sorry, look you showed up just in time."

At the back of the room Fox heard rustling around, he grabbed a blaster and whipped around aiming at the noise.

"Woah Captain cool it!"

Fox's eyes widened a little. It was Falco, so that's who Kevin called. No surprise, he was what most would call a fanboy of the old Star Fox team. Star Falco was the most he was going to get. It wasn't like their number was private either.

"If had known you were coming I would've left at least Leon for you to take down."

Falco looked surprised and then at Wolf and Panther on the ground. He then looked back up at Fox and holstered his blaster. Falco let out a small laugh of disbelief and stared at the Captain. "Either they've lost their touch or you're full of surprises Captain."

"Hey Falco I've still got it." Fox folded his arms, his self esteem diminishing with every old friend or foe entering the scene.

"Oh jeez Fox is that you?" Falco looked rather embarrassed. "Man I'm sorry, just didn't recognize you, you look well..."

"Yeah I got fat, seems like you're taking care of yourself though." Fox stood up and walked up to Falco. "I'd like to stay and chat but we have three unconscious criminals that just took down the entirety of a shuttle port, I'm assuming these aren't the only people here."

"You're right about that, there's a small army of mercs at the back of the port, they're looking to hijack a shuttle or two it seems."

"That's where the rest of the hostages are!" Jamie jumped up and ran to Fox and Falco.

"Yeah, it's just Star Falco here to do some clean up, but you'd better get home Fox."

"No Falco this is my port and I'm a captain."

"No Fox you have to leave."

"Look just because I'm a little out of shape..."

"Fox, as much as I'd like to have you to stay, you've got Krys and your son back home. Besides you earned a break." Falco gestured to the two unconscious bodies on the floor. "And I can't have you taking all the fun."

The chubby vulpine looked down and nodded. "Alright Falco, you get my port back though you hear? This jobs done me good."

"A little too good I think."

"Yeah yeah." Fox rolled his eyes and walked back to the entrance of the port. Jamie followed close behind.

"What now Captain?"

"Go home, lock your doors, pray they don't find you." Fox shrugged.

"No seriously." said Jamie.

"Who said I was joking?"

Jamie gulped, Fox laughed out loud and kept walking. "You remind me of a certain co-worker I used to have."

Krystal's eyes were glued to the screen, Fox had left for work about three hours earlier, and a shocking news broadcast had said "Lylat Jets" shuttleport had been attacked by an unknown terrorist threat. Cameras and a news chopper were positioned outside of the shuttle port while police officers had set up a barricade.

Star Falco had been called to the scene from the inside, which raised Krystals spirits, but her husband was in danger. She wrapped her arms around her legs and turned off the television. What a way to start the day. Shakily she walked to the kitchen and started to brew some tea, she always went to tea when her nerves were on edge. It was a mom trick she had learned from some neighbors down the way.

She had just taken her first sip when she heard foot steps behind her. She bolted around and spilled her tea a little. Standing right in front of her was her husband, his shirt was torn open, his furry belly hanging openly, three bloody scratches spread along the front. Dirt was smudged on his pants, and they sagged just a little.

"Fox!" She shouted and ran up to him, throwing her arms around him in tight embrace. He hugged her into him and stared into her.

"So much for safe working environment."

"I thought...I thought."

"Krys it's alright, I just got a little scratched up. My clothes took more damage than I did, speaking of which I need new pants." He blushed and gestured to the rip in the seam, the red fabric of his boxer shorts looked like a balloon. She went into a giggle fit and hugged him tighter.

"I get you whatever you want, I'm just glad you're ok."

"Well hey can you throw me some lunch together? I'm starved." He winked at her and stretched, pushing his belly forward.

"Are you seducing me, Mr. McCloud?" Krystal smiled softly.

"Just maybe."

"Well go get cleaned up, and save it for later, I said dinner was special tonight."

"You're such a tease." Fox said and smiled as he turned around and walked up stairs.

Fox felt the same self conscious feeling begin to well up in his meaty stomach when he saw Falco making small talk with Krystal in the living room, still Falco didn't look any worse for wear so that must mean the airline was safe he thought to himself.

"There's the man of the hour!" Falco exclaimed as he shot up to give his old comrade a pat on the back "You know for someone out of the biz you sure gave Wolf a good clobbering, he won't be talking for a while with the shape you left him in!"

"So where their any civilian casualties? Any damage to any of the aircrafts?" Fox asked hoping he could divert Falco from talking about the shape he was in smiling to himself as the self consciousness began to ease into a small amount of pride, while he was not exactly thrilled to get back into action it was always a nice thought that he still could even if he was a good 50 pounds past his prime.

"Falco was just saying the terrorist's where suppressed with minimal damage to the port." Krystal interjected as she handed Fox a drink, "Hostages secured and aircrafts all accounted for."

Fox sighed with relief as he took a swig of the cool beer his wife handed him, his port would be back in working order in no time.

"So how has Star Falco been running? Has the Great Fox been giving you any trouble?"

"We call her the Eagle's Roost now and you know how fickle the old gal can be, I swear most of our pay goes to maintenance for the damn thing." Falco said as he took his seat back.

"Sorry to hear that." Fox said feeling both a jab of annoyance at his father's ship being renamed as well as the twinge of resentment in his former wingmans tone

"Luckily I think I'm getting a sweet meal ticket from this gig though I hope you don't mind not getting a cut, you look like you eat well enough anyway." Falco snarked.

"Haha," Fox groaned sarcastically as he felt he insecurely gave his prominent stomach a rub, "Glad to see your as abrasive as ever."

"Serious! Fox I hardly recognized ya! Who woulda thunk baby faced Fox McCloud would look so grown up! Or rather grown out."

"Baby faced?" Fox asked quizzically.

Krystal suppressed a small giggle "Just a little bit."

Fox rolled his eyes and crossed his arms with a huff, he thought he looked sharp!

"So how was the taste of the old life Fox did it get the old blood boiling again? Or is it only cupcakes that do that for you now?" Falco asked

11311111.content:
"Nah just the cupcakes Falco.

"Really? Not even a little bit?" Falco looked surprised. "No thoughts of the good ol' days at all?"

"Those days weren't that good." Fox mused as he stretched.

"Come on there has to be some fighting spirit in there, otherwise you wouldn't have taken down Star Wolf."

"I did that because I was protecting what's mine Falco." Fox sat up straight and stared at his old wingmate. "That's the only reason I've ever done anything like that."

Falco looked a little distressed, Krystal could sense some unsaid feelings from him. Fox sipped his drink and shivered as the cold liquid traveled down his throat. On the outside he did seem perfectly reserved and confident about what was just said. Inside he felt a little remorse. He left his team on a bad note, something he never really got to make up. This really felt like Falco asking if Fox was really sure about moving on.

"You really have changed Fox." Falco said with a humorless chuckle. "All grown up right?"

"It's not just about me anymore, I have Marcus and Krystal to take care of."

"I remember when you said you never wanted a life like this."

"That was a long time ago Falco, you need to understand, I'd rather be fat and work the longest shifts in the world than see my family in danger."

Falco's mood didn't seem to improve, in fact he looked very annoyed. That friction between the two teammates had only grown stronger as the years have went by. Being a father really had changed Fox.

The room was quiet for a moment, Falco, folded his arms and looked at Fox. "Well if that is what you want, then so be it, thanks for your hospitality but I'd better get going."

"Falco wait" Krystal interjected. He stopped for a moment and looked at her. "Since today has been a big day and all, how about you and the team come by later today and join us for dinner."

Falco looked a little amused by the offer. "Do I have the big man's permission?"

Fox sighed. "Sure, bring the whole gang, I'm sure they'd like a decent meal."

"So its settled, it'll be like a family reunion, it's a little impromptu but I was preparing for a special night anyways." Krystal said as she walked over and kissed her husband on the cheek. "You should come by around 7, we should have everything set up."

Falco nodded. "I'll see you then, later McClouds."

Fox waited for Falco to leave the room and get as far away from earshot as possible. "Krystal what was that about?"

"What? I hate seeing you two like this, it's been years since we've seen any of them and it's all because you and Falco can't seem to keep anything civil between you two."

"So? If he can't accept I want this life right here and now then he's no friend of mine." Fox glared a little and watched Falco's car drive off from his window.

"He doesn't want to accept it because he's scared, he won't admit it, but I'm sure he liked it better when you called the shots and he could do his own thing." Krystal sat down in Fox's lap and stroked his hair.

Fox sighed. "Alright then," he slumped in his seat a little and closed his eyes, "oh and Krys?"

"Yes hon?"

"You do realize we're feeding 4 other people tonight right?"

"Yes that's right."

"And my special dinner for tonight is covering this?"

Krystal smiled a little and straddled Fox's lap. He looked up at her a little surprised and rubbed her back. "You said you wanted a big dinner."

"Are you trying to fatten me up?" Fox looked a little confused.

"Oh relax, you make sound like I intend to eat you."

"Well no, just wondering, what a bombshell babe like yourself would want with a butterball husband."

"I already told you." She replied and wrapped her arms around his neck. "You look like a man of experience."

"Well this man of experience is getting too flabby for his liking Krystal, I have no clue how I managed to survive today." Fox looked up into her eyes. "I need to get in some sort of shape, just in case."

She nodded and stroked his cheek. "I just want you safe at home, truth be told I don't want you actively running around out there getting into fights, and I think you'd be less inclined to do that with this extra heft."

"Well it seems you can take the Fox out of the fight but can't take the fight out of the Fox."

"Fox if you do start working out..."

"Yes Krystal?"

"Promise you'll try and stay a little big." Krystal looked down a little. "I'd be lying if I didn't say that you're new physique has been 'growing on me' so to speak."

Fox laughed a little. "Well alright if it makes you happy I'll come up with something."

The couple smiled at each other and locked into a deep embrace and kiss

Fox lazily opened his eyes, his bedside alarm clock read 3:00. The shower was running and he could hear Krystal humming in the bathroom. With a yawn he sat up and scratched his midsection, he draped his legs over the side of the bed and searched around for his discarded red boxers. He couldn't believe what he was thinking, he wanted to actually keep pudgy physique. It went against everything he knew. He instantly thought about the stages of grief, had he reached the acceptance stage?

He pulled the boxers up his thick legs and squeezed them on. He gazed at a mirror hanging off of the closet in his bedroom, and felt vulnerable. He never really saw himself in the mirror like this, he felt worse about himself than he did before, then he noticed them. The closet was cracked open, and poking out of a corner was a dumbbell. He had a few weights left over from his mercenary years, though they had really fallen into the wayside since Fox had become a little distracted with work and parenting. Perhaps he didn't have to lose any weight at all, rather build his body to support it, then everybody would win.

"Oh you're awake! I'm going to go pick Marcus up ok?" Krystal rushed over to Fox and gave him a hurried kiss. Before he could even answer she was out the door.

He had the place to himself, he grabbed his PDA and searched an online for a hardcore weight training supplies. He winced a little when he saw the prices, perhaps he should think about getting too far into it later. Right now he was kind of hungry, and in need of a snack.

Once downstairs and happily digging into a roast beef sandwich, he realized how well he had it. He had a steady job, with good income, he had three meals a day, with plenty of snacks on the side. While he wasn't exactly rolling in the dough, he was living better than he used to. Now just how was he going to make some extra cash on the side?

"No no bank left Marcus, bank left!" Fox shouted at the television as Marcus mashed the buttons on his controller. Unfortunately for Marcus' virtual ship, a homing missile locked on and blasted it to pieces. The gameover screen appeared and Marcus determined to win, hit 'try again.'

Krystal watched the two amused, she had dinner laid out on the table buffet style, and tables set up on the patio out back. It was about 6:50 PM, and their guests would soon be arriving. She walked over to her husband from behind and hugged him.

"Behave tonight you hear?"

"Yes master." Fox rolled his eyes and hugged her back.

"Good husband." She smiled a little and sat on the sofa. Before they knew it the door bell rang.

"I'll get it." Fox said. With a grunt he stood up and walked to the door. He was dressed casually, a t-shirt and some shorts Krystal bought the other day that were wide in the thighs and the seat. It was an unusually laid back look.

He opened the door and looked outside. "Wow you really came."

Falco chuckled at the remark. "All I had to say was free food."

"Well come inside, dinner's been cooling off."

Fox watched as his two former team members entered his home, nothing really had changed about them. Then Lucy and Dash came in, Lucy looked much more like her mother than her father, and Dash, well Fox had a strange suspicion as to whom he looked like.

"Nice place you have here Fox." Slippy chirped.

"It's not much but its home." Fox shrugged.

Soon everyone got acquainted with eachother, in Fox's case he got reacquainted with most of his house guests. Krystal had outdone herself that night, the food was great. Fox almost didn't realize he was going back for thirds, pretty soon it was fifths.

"You know if I had her cooking for me," Falco remarked, "I'd be as big as you too Fox."

As the evening winded down, Fox realized that he was still helping himself to the food. It seemed his body had accepted his wife's proposal faster than he did. Which reminded him.

"Falco, about earlier..."

"Don't sweat it, I know you're all Mr. Responsible and such now, but believe me it suits you."

"Well I was wondering if I could somehow work something for you guys on the side? I need some extra cash I've realized, for something special." Fox gestured towards Krystal.

"Ah, but you want it out of the action and close to home." Falco folded his arms. "Well...

Fox quirked an eyebrow in curiosity as he swallowed another mouthful. "Do tell."

Falco clasped his feathered hands, "Its nothing major, we just need someone to fly some cargo to us every now and again."

Fox cringed at the idea. "Transporting cargo? So your asking me to use my position in the airline to start a smuggling ring?"

The azure pheasant, waved his hand in dismissal "No no nothing like that, we're just looking for a pilot to bring us a few crates of munitions and supplies here and there so we don't have to bring the Eagle's Roost to port as often."

The pilot rubbed the underside of his padded muzzle as he contemplated the proposal. "You sure I'd be out of the action? I mean I'm transporting supplies to an armed vessel."

Falco rolled his eyes at his former leader "Its not like we're gonna call if we're in the middle of a warzone you know?" he said

The vulpine looked to his wife as she contemplated it as well "While I'm not to thrilled with the idea of you transporting military cargo I can't see it being much more dangerous then your day job either."

Fox nodded as he thought about it himself.

The avian noticed Fox would have to think about his offer, "Well you know our number big guy, we'll be around til tomorrow so you can let us know when you decide." He said as he rubbed Marcus's head as he took his leave from the McCloud home.

Fox kept his green eyes focused on the mirror as he observed his flabbier bloated body, he wasn't sure why he had this insecure fixation on his looks today; sure his body wasn't in the best of shape but he knew he was far from anyone's definition of ugly, he certainly enjoyed the extra helpings he could eat now that he was bigger, he had a gorgeous wife and a loving son and he definitely wasn't looking to go back to the life of a mercenary that lived pay check to pay check... His thoughts drifted back to his encounter with Star Wolf and the exhaustion he felt from a short distance sprint, it couldn't hurt to be in a bit better shape either.

But the vulpine's musings where cut short when he felt his stomach twist as if to remind him it was about time for some before bed snackage.

He laughed to himself a bit absentmindedly rubbing his tummy while he headed to the kitchen "Well Krystal should be happy to hear no matter what you aren't going anywhere." he said finally content with the idea of staying large and in charge.

Fox savored the spoonful of ice cream as his wife walked in, just finishing putting Marcus to bed. Smiling he walked up and gave her a kiss that she eagerly returned.

"Today's been awfully turbulent huh?" She said resting her face in his chest. "Lucky the airline will be closed tomorrow cuz of all the commotion, I forgot to get you a new pair of big boy pants."

The pilot laughed as he ate another spoonful, "Well buy em a bit roomier this time, in case I need room to grow." He joked as he bumped Krystal with his belly.

Krystal shared in the laughter and gave him a peck on the cheek, "Will do sir! Can't have the big boss man going around with his underwear showing."

"Nah that privilege is reserved for Mrs McCloud." He flirted as he put the now empty bowl into the sink. "But how would she go for having a little beef with her pork?" Fox joked as he flexed his flaccid arm to make his point.

"A double order? Oh that would go over quite nicely I think."

"So do you think I should then? Take up Falco's offer I mean, excersize equipment isn't exactly cheap."

Krystal paused a moment as the air thickened "...I don't know Fox, I just... I just don't want you heading back to the old life you know? Full of danger, after the worry I went through today..."

The pilot embraced his wife with tender understanding "I know, but you don't have to worry about me heading back that life. I have everything I want right here. Besides a big guy like me can't quite live pay check to pay check on instant noodles anymore."

"I know Fox, I trust you. So whatever you choose I will support it." She said snuggling close to his meaty body.

2 weeks later

         Fox stared out the windshield of his shuttle into the deep expanse of space. Far off into the distance he could see his father's old ship.
